critique: The executive order aims to convey a sense of seriousness and determination in combating terrorism. It invokes legal authority and outlines specific actions to strengthen sanctions against foreign terrorists. The intended emotions are primarily fear (related to the threat of terrorism) and a sense of resolve or determination (to address the threat). There might be a slight element of surprise due to the termination of a previous order and the introduction of new measures, but this is less prominent. Disgust and sadness are not primary emotions the order seeks to evoke.
